name: Ahmed Ibrahim
aboutme: Passionate, high-performing Full Stack Developer with more than 3 years of experience. My experience ranges from working on real-time messaging systems that can handle thousands of daily messages to scale opensource projects with more than 1+ million active users. Currently seeking a role as a Full-Stack Developer at a progressive organization, where applied knowledge and self-education skills meet.
experienceOverview: My name is Ahmed Ibrahim. I have been in the industry for more than 3 years as a Full Stack Developer.

I was a founding member of a team to develop a cross-chain bridge to enable users to move their tokens between different chains easly. I was responsible for building the required infrastructure for it to enable our users to move their tokens between 12 diffirent blockchains. During this time I reduced the average response time for our most imporant APIs from 12s to be just 2s (6x faster).

Then I used this as leverage to go to a bigger organization in Turcky. I was responsible for maintaining a multi-channel chating service in which users can interact with all of their customers  on Twitter and WhatsApp from one place! I was responsible for creating data-collection piplines to analyze and get insights from data then display it to our users in an easy to read graphs. Also I was researching solutions to our deployment issues we had it at the time.

Then I used this as leverage to go to a bigger organization in Turcky. I was responsible for maintaining a multi-channel chating service in which users can interact with all of their customers  on Twitter and WhatsApp from one place! I was responsible for creating data-collection piplines to analyze and get insights from data then display it to our users in an easy to read graphs. Also I was researching solutions to our deployment issues we had it at the time.
Currently seeking a role as a Full-stack Developer at a progressive organization

company.name: Synpress
company.about: Synpress is a true E2E testing framework based on Cypress and Playwright with support for MetaMask.

roles: Helped the project get sponsored & funded with more than 350k USD.
Planning how to spend the funds, organize the work, hit the milestones, and popularize the project.
Adding new features, responding to issues, reviewing pull requests, refactoring the codebase, writing tests, and improving documentation.
Migrated the project to TypeScript, reduced package size, and added headless browser support.
Getting more adaption to the project by creating online documentation, lunching a landing page, and interacting with the community.

company.name: Panther Protocol
company.about: Panther Protocol is an end-to-end solution that restores privacy in Web3 and DeFi while providing financial institutions with full ownership of their data as they participate in decentralized finance.

roles: Took full responsibility & accountability over delivering critical features.
Reduced bundle size by 50% & Analyzed performance bottlenecks.
Improve the CI/CD speed (IPFS, Selective CI/CD Script Runner).
Took the initiative to introduce end-to-end testing to our code base.
Increase the backend syncing speed by 50x (from 50s to 1s).

company.name: EMURGO
company.about: EMURGO is the official commercial arm and a founding entity of the Cardano blockchain.

roles: Develop public API to enable other developers to build their own dApps on top of Cardano and to serve more than 1 million active users.
Tackle performance bottlenecks related to databases and memory leaks.
Manage the software development lifecycle (Planning, Design, Development, QA).
Improve the front-end experience by implementing an entirely new revamped theme.
Wrote end-to-end and unit tests to ensure app integrity.
Review PRs and make sure they follow the code standards and best practices.
Onboard new developers and help them fit into the team.

company.name: Spherium
company.about: The Gateway to a cross-chain interoperable ecosystem that lets users bridge tokens on multiple chains.

roles: Founding member of a team to develop a cross-chain bridge platform
Build the required infrastructure for a transaction queue (API, Cron Job, Scheduler).
Integrated new 12 blockchains that allowed users to easily move tokens between them.
Reduced average request time for most important endpoints from 12s to 2s (6x faster).
Onboarding new developers and helping them fit into the team.

videos.title: But How JavaScript Actually Works ?!
videos.description: In this video, I will explain how JavaScript actually works. This includes explaining fundamental concepts in JavaScript like the Call Stack, Callback Queue, WebAPI, and Event Loop,...

videos.description: In this video, I will talk about the Fetch API and the underlying HTTP Protocol, and how the frontend interacts with the server. All of these with in-depth detailed examples to make sure you understand the concepts on a deeper level

videos.description: In this video, I am talking about one of the confusing topics in JavaScript.  I discussed where the confusing natures of the "this" keyword come from and various use cases.

projects.name: Yoroi Wallet
description: A simple, secure and fast Cardano ADA wallet.
Yoroi allows users to manage ADA in their browser.
It is a lightweight wallet that launches quickly, allowing users to start sending or receiving ADA in minutes.

screenshots.description: Create or Restor your Cardano wallet
View your funds and track you rewards

projects.name: Wallet Ecommerce
description: A mobile friendly, production ready and fully featured e-commerce website.

projects.name: Panther Protocol
description: Panther Protocol is an end-to-end solution that restores privacy in Web3 and DeFi while providing financial institutions with full ownership of their data as they participate in decentralized finance.
Advanced zero-knowledge privacy and trust on any blockchain

screenshots.description: Stake your assets on a Zero Knowledge Staking Pool
View your rewards & redeem any time
Get test ZKP tokens on testnet

projects.name: Receptor
description: Send and receive messages with friends and groups
Available as a website and as MacOS, Linux, and Windows application.

screenshots.description: Chat in groups with your friends
Create groups with your best friends
See if your friends active or not!

js.name: JavaScript
js.about: JavaScript (JS) is a lightweight, interpreted, or just-in-time compiled programming language with first-class functions.

ts.name: TypeScript
ts.about: TypeScript is a strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript, giving you better tooling at any scale.

rust.name: Rust
rust.about: Rust is blazingly fast and memory-efficient: with no runtime or garbage collector, it can power performance-critical services, run on embedded devices, and easily integrate with other languages.

python.name: Python
python.about: Python is a programming language that lets you work quickly and integrate systems more effectively.

node.name: NodeJS
node.about: Node.js® is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.

express.name: Express

django.name: Django

flask.name: Flask

actix.name: Actix

react.name: React

tailwind.name: Tailwind
tailwind.about: Rapidly build modern websites without ever leaving your HTML.

mui.name: Material UI
mui.about: MUI provides a simple, customizable, and accessible library of React components.

sass.name: SASS
sass.about: Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world.

html.name: HTML
html.about: HTML5 is a markup language used for structuring and presenting content on the World Wide Web.

css.name: CSS
css.about: Cascading Style Sheets is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language such as HTML

graphql.name: GraphQL
graphql.about: GraphQL is a query language for APIs and a runtime for fulfilling those queries with your existing data

mysql.name: MySQL
mysql.about: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

postgres.name: PostgreSQL

redis.name: Redis

docker.name: Docker
docker.about: Containerization technology that enables the creation and use of Linux® containers.

git.name: Git

jest.name: Jest

cypress.name: Cypress

pandas.name: Pandas

sklearn.name: Scikit-Learn

tensorflow.name: Tensorflow

opencv.name: OpenCV
opencv.about: OpenCV provides a real-time optimized Computer Vision library, tools, and hardware. It also supports model execution for Machine Learning (ML)

wasm.name: Webassembly
wasm.about: WebAssembly (abbreviated Wasm) is a binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine. Wasm is designed as a portable compilation target for programming languages, enabling deployment on the web for client and server applications.

bash.name: BASH
bash.about: Bash is the shell, or command language interpreter, for the GNU operating system.

vim.name: VIM
vim.about: Vim is a highly configurable text editor built to make creating and changing any kind of text very efficient.

apollo.name: Apollo

socketio.name: Socket.io
